title: The Tribes East of the Jordan
summary: Numbers 32 tells how the tribes of Reuben and Gad, seeing fertile land east of the Jordan, ask to settle there. Moses agrees only after they promise to help conquer the land west of the Jordan first. The half-tribe of Manasseh also receives land in the region.

faq.question: Why did Reuben and Gad want to settle east of the Jordan?
faq.answer: They had large herds and saw the land was good for livestock.

faq.question: Did they agree to help conquer the rest of the land?
faq.answer: Yes, they promised to fight with the rest of Israel before returning to settle.
